website_summaries.verdict: While its camera isn't best-in-class and Windows Phone's underwhelming app selection still stings, the elegant and sophisticated HTC One M8 is an enticing alternative to Nokia models.
pros: Verizon's HTC One M8 brings premium style to the Windows Phone franchise, has a brilliant 1080p display and excellent audio speakers, and it's powered by a robust quad-core processor
cons: The Windows Phone OS has a smaller app market, the handset's battery is nonremovable, and like the Android M8s before it, photos aren't as sharp as those from its competitors

website_summaries.verdict: The HTC One (M8) for Windows marries high-end design with modern specs for Microsoft's underdog mobile ecosystem.
pros: Cool depth-of-field tricks on main camera
cons: Main camera fails to impress overall

website_summaries.verdict: This is Android's iPhone, a flexible and beautiful phone that most will love
pros: Amazing design and a great user interface
cons: While flexible the camera results are not as good as those from other phones

website_summaries.verdict: The One (M8) continues HTC's reign as the maker of the best-designed Android smartphones. It oozes with style and sophistication, but makes some compromises compared with the Galaxy S5. Still, it shares the Editors' Choice badge with the Galaxy S5 for best Android phone on Verizon.
pros: Cool depth-of-field tricks on main camera
cons: Main camera fails to impress overall

customer_reviews.text: Great smartphone, good size neither too big nor too small, and runs fast especially with an SD card used as extra RAM. Call quality is good, picks up the network well, and the onscreen keyboard sits nicely under the thumb with well-designed predictive text. Good camera too. The whole thing looks and feels like an expensive phone.
customer_reviews.author: Swan Man

customer_reviews.title: The phone is very good and is exactly what is advertised
customer_reviews.text: The phone is very good and is exactly what is advertised. However, it is rooted which at the time it didn't specify. My HTC M8 requires the LCD screen replacing, I've had the phone for a few months and not once have I dropped it, thus I've given only 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Axel Severus Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: Arrived without manufacturers warranty
customer_reviews.text: Arrived without manufacturers warranty or indeed any other warranty information, no details of serial number. Unsure if truly new for this reason. Box had been opened previously as stated it would be, however would expect all of the leaflets etc to still be there. Have asked the seller for details, not using the phone until these issues are clarified, I would expect a new phone to have these included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs!!
customer_reviews.text: I received my phone on time and I couldn't be more delighted until I found the HTC box was not sealed and the phone inside was faulty. It makes a clicking sound when ever I use an app. I have been sold a bad item and couldn't be more disappointed and angry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The delivery was very quick and the phone itself looks in very good condition however in the short time I have had it I have had to preform two factory resets due to the phone crashing and the back camera has stopped working. I don't know if other customers have had similar experiences or if I have just been unlucky but overall I'm not impressed.
